provider-org.narrative: MPTF-UN Sustainable Development Framework Fund For Pakistan(2018-2022)
UNITED STATES AGENCY FOR INTERNATIONAL DEVELOPMENT (USAID)
UNITED STATES AGENCY FOR INTERNATIONAL DEVELOPMENT (USAID)
UNITED STATES AGENCY FOR INTERNATIONAL DEVELOPMENT (USAID)
UNITED STATES AGENCY FOR INTERNATIONAL DEVELOPMENT (USAID)

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).

description.narrative: 1.3: Extent to which the ECP engages constructively with stakeholders especially women. Scale: 1. Not adequately: 2. Very partially: 3. Partially: 4. Largely: 5. Fully

comment.narrative: 1.3: Scale 3 (partially) Training initiative for young women on election process conducted, Public outreach and voter information exercise conducted for 2019 electoral events; Support provided to ECPs Women NIC Registration Campaign)

.3 Scale 3: UNDP/SELP carried out public outreach activities in newly-merged districts during Provincial Assembly elections in July 2019. The activities were also carried out during by-election in different constituencies across the country. The project also continued women NIC and voter registration campaigns during the reporting year. Outreach interventions for voter verification through ECP’s Display Centers also carried out across the country.

1.1 Scale 3: Adequate (Adequate administrative processes/training plans/training Extent to which the ECP’s institutional capacity is enhanced.) 1.2 Scale 3 Adequate (Adequate administrative processes/training plans/training Extent to which the ECP delivers improved electoral administration.) 1.3. Scale 3: Moderately (Engagement strategies/mechanicisms exist and implemented, Gender strategy/gender-centric initiatives exit and implemented) 2.1: Scale 3 = Partially (Basic understanding of SDGs and partial engagement with SDGs/development processes) 2.2:Extent to which the technical skills of legislators and Secretariat staff are enhanced. Scale 3- Partially (Basic understanding of legislative mechanisms/processes) Extent to which legislative institutions actively engage with the SDGs/development processes. 2.3: Extent to which parliamentary institutions are prepared to function during crisis/emergency situations-Scale 3= Partially (Basic awareness and preparedness). 3.1 (Number of citizens reached through civic literacy initiatives) 16,000 (M: 12,000, F: 4,000) 4.1: Number of trainings conducted for media professionals (0, no target)

1.1. Scale 3: UNDP/SELP enhanced the ECP’ institutional capacity by providing support for the development of a) mandate, scope and framework for the Federal Election Academy (FEA) b) trained 32 ECP officials on ‘Activity Planning’, developed finalized activity plans at the wing level for effective implementation of ECP’s Strategic Plan and developed monitoring tools for activities c) trained 27 ECP officials on Protection against Harassment of Women at the Workplace Act 2010 d) reached out to over 92 million Pakistanis for a voter verification process e) published a legally mandated Annual Report to Parliament f) held discussions on the development of a Gender Mainstreaming and Social Inclusion Framework- (partially achieved as due to covid 19 NADRA offices were closed and their registration vans were grounded. The gender mainstreaming strategy has been initiated and is in progress): The project continued to support the nationwide joint ECP-NADRA Womens NIC and Voter Registration Campaign to reduce the gender gap between males and females on the electoral roll. UNDP/SELP supported the ECPs implemention of the Campaign in partnership with Trust for Democractic Education and Accountability in 85 districts, which has a network of member organizations across Pakistan. UNDP/SELP registered 132,715 women for their NICs and to become voters. UNDP/SELP ensured ECPs constructive engagement with stakeholders, and partners at the national, provincial and districts levels. UNDP/SELP in collaboration with TDEA also conducted a media campaign to the support this campaign. UNDP/SELP held discussions with the ECPs Gender unit for the development of a Gender Mainstreaming and Social Inclusion Framework. 1.2:Scale 3 (The prerequisite for the electoral events are complete. However, the electoral administration will take place during the local government elections, which are yet to be held next year): UNDP/SELP supported the ECP a) to develop training materials for Boundary Delimitation in Punjab, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa and Sindh and for the Local Government Elections in Punjab and Khyber Pakhtunkhwa (KP) and for the Cantonment Board Elections b) to train 21 ECP officials at FEA for the boundary delimitation process in Punjab, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa and Sindh and 229 delimitation committee members of Punjab and KP c) to train 47 officials for the LG elections in Punjab to carry out their election duties d) to developSOPs for LG electoral process. In addition, UNDP provided support to the Punjab Local Government Department in the preparation of rules for the upcoming LG elections. 1.3: 3 Scale 3 (Partially achieved as due to covid 19 NADRA offices were closed and their registration vans were grounded. The gender mainstreaming strategy has been initiated and is in progress). The project continued to support the nationwide joint ECP-NADRA Womens NIC and Voter Registration Campaign to reduce the gender gap between males and females on the electoral roll. UNDP/SELP supported the ECPs implemention of the Campaign in partnership with Trust for Democractic Education and Accountability in 85 districts, which has a network of member organizations across Pakistan. UNDP/SELP registered 132,715 women for their NICs and to become voters. UNDP/SELP ensured ECPs constructive engagement with stakeholders, and partners at the national, provincial and districts levels. UNDP/SELP in collaboration with TDEA also conducted a media campaign to the support this campaign. Additionally, UNDP/SELP held discussions with the ECPs Gender unit for the development of a Gender Mainstreaming and Social Inclusion Framework. 2.2: Scale 3: The project mobilized lawmakers of Balochistan and Khyber Pakhtunkhwa (KP) Assemblies through establishing and supporting SDGs Task Forces. With UNDP/SELP support, the MPs established linkages with different departments of the provincial governments and as a result, multiple briefing sessions were (3 in the reporting year) held in which 12 senior officials of relevant branches of the executive were invited to brief the lawmakers about the progress on various SDG-related schemes/projects in addition to explaining the challenges for the lawmakers could take up the matter in the Assembly session to address those. 2.3: Scale 3: UNDP/SELP is conducting Business Continuity Assessments studies of the Senate, and the Balochistan and KP Assemblies with a view to enabling the legislative houses to identify issues and challenges related to the legal framework, administrative and IT infrastructure and capacity to function during the times of crisis. Similarly, the project is also developing two separate Guides on the oversight role of committees for Balochistan and KP Assemblies to enable the targeted committees to continue functioning during times of crises such as Covid-19. To this regard, the draft frameworks and consultations with the Secretarit and political leadership of respective assemblies are completed. The project has also provided online tools to Balochistan and KP assemblies for continued remote working during Covid-19. UNDP/SELP is providing the associated training on the use of technology to hold virtual sessions. 3.1: 425,247 people (F: 17,345, M: 21,151, T: 34, Misc: 386,717), through 947 civic awareness sessions conducted by UNVs. Outreach through ECP-NADRA NIC campaign (directly reached) 95,286 individuals through 3,586 stakeholder and mobilization activities. TV and radio media campaign media Campaignreached out to 86.2 miilion people. Campaign attributed to the registration of over 1.8 million women.Additional support to the ECP for the voter verification process an outreach campaign through radio and television reached out to 92.25 million people. 4.1: No trainings reported.
